question: Which institution in its global report in coronavirus, estimated that most economies will not return to pre-pandemic levels until 2022?
explanation:
Moody's Investors Service released its global report in coronavirus and highlighted that though the credit challenges arising out of COVID-19 will be short-lived, most economies will not return to pre-pandemic activity levels until 2022.
It expects a slow and bumpy global recovery and uncertainty around the macroeconomic outlook remains higher than the usual level.
